headline: Rep. Kat Cammack backs Mike Gibbons in Ohio GOP Senate primary
author: Tyler Olson
sentences: Cammack is a member of the 2020 GOP House freshman class that significantly exceeded expectations last year when Republicans gained seats in the House of Representatives despite losing the Senate and the presidency.
Gibbons has been at or near the top of most polls in the Ohio GOP Senate primary, with former Ohio state Treasurer Josh Mandel a close second, according to a Fox News Poll from early last month.
Rep. Kat Cammack is endorsing Ohio Senate candidate Mike Gibbons in the state's Republican primary Wednesday, adding a young national GOP voice to the investment banker's corner.
Rob Portman, R-Ohio, is retiring after his current term, which opened up his seat for what is expected to be a key race in deciding control of the Senate in the fall.
Cammack grabbed headlines last year with an impassioned speech against Democrats' reconciliation spending bill, which she said she was voting "hell no" against.
Vance, former Ohio Republican Party Chair Jane Timken and Ohio state Sen. Matt Dolan also had some support from polled voters in the competitive primary.
The class of GOP lawmakers was historically diverse, especially on gender, causing GOP leaders to dub 2020 the "year of the Republican woman."
"Mike will bring a much-needed perspective on how to limit the size and scope of the federal government and get our economy back on track.
But he's gotten more than a dozen in-state endorsements from county Republican Party groups and current and former state GOP officials.
"Mike Gibbons is a true conservative voice that will best serve Ohioans in the U.S. Senate," Cammack, R-Fla., said Wednesday.
"I look forward to working with her in Washington to cut spending and curb inflation caused by Democrats' reckless policies.
Notably, Gibbons hasn't had as many splashy out-of-state endorsements as some other candidates in the GOP primary.
The winner of the GOP primary is expected to face Rep. Tim Ryan, D-Ohio, in the general election.
Cammack joins Sen. Rand Paul, R-Ky., as an out-of-state Republican backing Gibbons.
"I am humbled to have Congresswoman Cammack's endorsement," Gibbons said.
I'm honored to endorse him in the Ohio Senate primary race."
Together we will fight for the America First agenda."
He will be a fighter for the America First agenda.
The state primary in Ohio is May 3.
"Hillbilly Elegy" author J.D.
